intro: Reseda lanceolata var. maura, commonly known as Maura's sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands.
